scans.name: MRI
scans.description: A powerful tool that uses strong magnetic fields to produce images

scans.name: CT
scans.description: A sensitive diagnostic tool used to image many diseases and injuries

scans.name: PET/CT
scans.description: A diagnostic tool used mainly in oncology, neurology, cardiology, infection and inflammation, and in planning surgery and treatment

scans.name: X-ray
scans.description: An established tool used to produce images of tissues, bones and organs

scans.name: Ultrasound
scans.description: A versatile tool that generates images using high frequency sound waves

scans.name: Bone densitometry (DEXA)
scans.description: An analytical technique used to assess mineral bone density and can diagnose osteoporosis

scans.name: Fluoroscopy
scans.description: An imaging technique that uses X-rays to obtain real-time moving images of the internal structures of a patient through the use of a fluoroscope.
